text: MGS4's iconic theme. It echoes what the game is about: sins, atonement, the inevitability of passing time, and one last desperate mission.

text: I have the opinion where this is where the entire sage for MGS ended here. Yeah, all the side games were fun before Konami decided the hated being a game developer, but it truly was the end of a sage and then finally all of us wanted.

text: One sage ended, but a different parsley began.

text: I love metal gear so this is a real treat.

text: Great game, sadly cutscenes were longer than gameplay :L
author: Ahmed360

text: Glad to see you finally added this masterpiece to your VGM collection. MGS4 is an amazing game, the shitty love stories of it not withstanding. It needed way more gameplay in Act 3 and 5, but it's still fantastic. The best gameplay in the series, because it removes the MGS3 healing system that requires you to go through the menu too much, adds octocamo and crouch walking, and has the rations and other stuff from MGS2.
author: Happytreefriendsfan3

text: This game holds so much for me... It's what prompted me getting the ps3 back in 2008. I bought the collection for the ps2 and played through all of them right before buying this. It was worth it all. The time and money spent on this series is something I will never forget or regret. Thank you Supra for stirring up these emotions and memories again!
author: animefanatic777

text: Video games have changed. Its not about being fun or having a compelling story anymore.

text: Seeing Richard Doyle as Big Boss during the credits blew my mind. Not because of Richard Doyle, but because I knew something amazing was about to happen, since we thought Big Boss was "dead" the whole game. To me, it's still one of the greatest games ever made.

author: Kakashi Hatake

text: The meme will forever live on
author: Lucio Fernandes

text: Kojima not being involved with Metal Gear Solid anymore is the end of the golden era of the franchise. There are some game series that simply cannot be the same without their creators, I can also think of Silent Hill/Team Silent or Final Fantasy/Sakaguchi. It's just not the same anymore. Metal Gear Survive is obviously a side-game and I'm wondering if Konami will ever bother trying to make a real entry. You had a good run Snake.
author: SupraDarky

text:
Let's hope Death Stranding lives up to its potential.
It'll be interesting to see how a Kojima game without Konami's involvement will be.
author: BrokenMoonStudios

text: So true, MGS died after Kojima left.
author: Guilherme

text: Kojima didn't make the MGS games great on his own. KojiPro was filled with talented individuals from top to bottom, and their combined might gave us these great games. Kojima may have been the face and voice of the series, but without worker ants, a queen ant doesn't amount to much.
author: Shad G

text:
All Konami needs is passion. If the developers that Kojima left behind at the company can muster any genuine interest and love for the series then we might actually see some amazing results. 

I mean, look at Kirby. The series creator, Masahiro Sakurai, has little to no involvement with most of the titles and yet it managed to maintain its quality standards and far surpass it in some cases.
author: Lucas

text: I hope kojima buys the ip
